item.title: Writing custom visualizers for Visual Studio 2005
item.description: The native debugger in Visual Studio has long had an underadvertised feature called autoexp.dat , which is a file in the PackagesDebugger folder that allows you to control several aspects of the debugger. Among the features that you can control in autoexp.dat include: the string that is displayed for types in the variable panes, which functions the debugger will skip
